medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent scalp dermatitis and suspected onychomycosis of the nails.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms were evaluated in preparation for autologous cord-blood stem cell transplantation. Physical examination revealed thick greasy scale and mild vertex alopecia on the scalp, and markedly hyperkeratotic nails with pronounced subungual debris. Pruritus was absent, which is characteristic of Norwegian scabies in immunocompromised patients.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with IPEX syndrome; known health conditions include congenital absence of pancreatic islands resulting in neonatal type-1 diabetes and other related immunological issues.
medical_history.family_history: Recurrent scabies infestations in all family members, including a 6-month-old brother with IPEX syndrome.
